main event: On 13 March 1955, military pilots observed a silvery object the size of a weather balloon at an altitude of 20,000 feet over Salton Sea, California. The object seemed to accelerate and disappeared from sight in about 3 minutes, with an estimated speed of 251 knots at 43,000 feet.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by military pilots of a DC-7 airliner flying at 20,000 feet.
The object was initially compared to the size of a weather balloon.
The estimated speed of the object was 251 knots at 43,000 feet.
The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes before the object disappeared from sight.
The report lists possible conclusions including 'was aircraft', 'probably balloon', and 'possibly aircraft'.
sighted object: One silvery object the size of a weather balloon
